messages.title: MESSAGE TO THE RESIDENTS OF SHEPPEY
messages.content: This is a General Election that nobody really wanted, including me, but which I believe is necessary to break the impasse in a zombie Parliament that has consistently refused to allow the Government to govern or deliver the Brexit for which 17.4 million people voted almost three and a half years ago.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Supports the Brexit Withdrawal Agreement and Political Declaration Boris Johnson negotiated with the EU. Believes it will protect jobs and livelihoods.

mentions.candidate: I believe I am that person.
mentions.tacticalSituation: The tactical situation is implied in the argument for why residents should vote for the candidate, as it's claimed that the candidate understands local challenges and can be trusted to represent their interests.

issues.brexitEurope: Argues the necessity of the General Election to deliver the Brexit for which 17.4 million people voted and supports the Withdrawal Agreement Boris Johnson negotiated with the EU.
issues.governance: Mentions the impasse in the current Parliament, contrasting with delivering on the democratic decision of Brexit.

leaflet.personalStatement: I know the challenges Islanders face, because I have lived on Sheppey for almost 40 years. Your challenges are my challenges.

images.caption: An image of Gordon Henderson with the Conservative party logo at the top and his signature at the bottom.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet advocates for electing a candidate who understands the local issues of the Isle of Sheppey and who can be trusted to stand up for the Island and keep their word.
